text: Kyoto Station (京都駅, Kyōto-eki?) is the most important transportation centers in Kyoto, Japan. It has Japan's second-largest train station building (after Nagoya Station). It is also one of the country's largest buildings, with a shopping mall, hotel, movie theater, Isetan department store, and several local government facilities under one 15-story roof. It also housed the Kyoto City Air Terminal until August 31, 2002. ==Other websites== *Official site Wikimedia Commons has media related to: Kyoto Station Category:Railway stations in Kyoto Prefecture
title: Kyoto Station
